softSkills.title: Mindfulness and focus
softSkills.text:
About six months ago I mastered the Pomodoro technique, which helps me focus on things.
She changed my life quite a lot.
During this time, I trained myself not to be distracted by anything and enter the flow state while the tomato is going (50 min of work / 10 min of rest).
I also keep records in the toDo(TickTick) application, which helps me not to forget anything and record the time spent on tasks.

softSkills.title: Ability to work in a team
softSkills.text:
At the last job, interacting with the team, it was necessary to be able to adapt to each other and issue different tasks.
Because in literally one task, the next one could immediately follow.
Therefore, I know firsthand what it is to work in a team :)

softSkills.title: Responsibility
softSkills.text: Both in life and in work, I approach everything responsibly. If I take on something, I bring it to the end. No one from my team could say that I was irresponsible. Rather, on the contrary, they were praised for this quality.

softSkills.title: Independence
softSkills.text:
I study programming on my own. Well, how to do it yourself - according to courses, documentation and YouTube :)
I also study English myself, using various applications, educational books, and fiction.
I live an independent life: I provide for myself, clean, cook, etc.

softSkills.title: Communication
softSkills.text:
In my last job, I interacted productively with both management and staff.
The organization consisted of 8 people. He offered his ideas for solving certain tasks, tried to help get out of various situations concerning the organization.
Periodically interacted with customers when required.

hardSkills.title: JavaScript
text: I have been studying since 02.2022. During the acquaintance I studied: variables, objects, arrays, functions, mutations, scopes, operators, expressions and instructions, functional expressions, ternary operator, loops, classes, prototypes, promises, asynchronous functions (fetch, async/await), API, etc.
Periodically I study new information to improve my understanding of the work of JS.

hardSkills.title: React
text: I started studying React from 05.2022. I started my journey by studying the class React and using it I made an MVP project from the course. After completion of the class React study, I switched to functional. I studied the functional components, HOC, Hooks, react-router-dom.

hardSkills.title: GIT
text: I have been using Git since the beginning of studying programming. I can create my own repositories, work with other people's repositories and perform basic operations.

hardSkills.title: English
text: I have a good vocabulary (more than 5000 words), I know English at the B1 level, I constantly read fiction and improve my level of English. I studied at an English language school.

hardSkills.title: TypeScript
text: I know how to use TypeScript in React, I understand itâ€™s importance for large projects.

hardSkills.title: Docker
text: I took a docker course and learned: what is a docker for; what is a container, an image; how to create images; open and closed ports, volume connection, docker.yml structure and docker-compose.yml.
During the course, I launched a small container consisting of a backend, database, frontend and Adminer (database administration tool).

hardSkills.title: HTML/SCSS
text: I know how to use semantic tags. Embed tags correctly. I give him at least an hour every day.
I understand the main points of SCSS. I constantly use it to create projects on React. I am able to find solutions for tasks related to layout.
